Description.val:
The Information Systems Security Program (ISSP) ensures the protection of Navy and joint cyberspace systems from exploitation and attack.  Systems include wired and wireless telecommunications systems, cybersecurity systems, and the content processed, stored, or transmitted therein. ISSP includes protection of the Navy's National Security Systems (NSS).

The rapid change in the underlying commercial and government cyber infrastructures makes cybersecurity an increasingly complex and dynamic problem. ISSP provides the Navy's warfighter the essential information trust characteristics of availability, confidentiality, integrity, authentication, and non-repudiation. Cybersecurity and remediation activities must evolve quickly to meet the rapidly evolving threats and vulnerabilities.

[P5 / Public Key Infrastructure (DA018)]: PKI implements a secure infrastructure for the generation, management, and delivery of digital certificates for secure electronic transactions, hardware certificate-based two-way authentication to networks, applications, and web servers; and secure email.

[P5 / Cybersecurity Virtual Secure Enclave (VSE) (DA070)]: Cybersecurity VSE is the follow-on limited transition of capabilities from the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) / Pacific Command (PACOM) sponsored VSE Joint Capability Technology Demonstration (JCTD). The technology provides a virtual secure enclave within existing networks that create a two-way encrypted tunnel between locations. Client Nodes (CN) and deployable Fly Away Kits (FAK) expand user level access to the existing system architecture which is required for the execution of various operational plans.

[P3A / Computer Network Defense (CND) Increment 2- Afloat (DA070)]: Computer Network Defense (CND) is a layered protection strategy, using Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) and Government Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) hardware and software products that collectively provide an effective network security infrastructure.  

CND Afloat systems include: System and host-based cybersecurity protection tools such as Host Based Security System (HBSS), Operation Rolling Tide (ORT)/cyber remediation tools including Assured Configuration Assessment Solution (ACAS), supporting hardware and software for Department of Defense (DoD) mandated tools, Information Assurance Tracking System (IATS), Operating System Environment (OSE), enhanced data correlation tools, switches, ancillary devices and other related security tools.  ORT/ cyber remediation tools will accelerate the Navy's ability to prevent, constrain, and mitigate cyber-attacks and critical vulnerabilities in order to achieve improved network defense and security wholeness.  ORT will procure modern network sensors improving the ability to detect unusual network patterns and prevent/deter malicious attacks.  Remediation tools will provide hardened boundary protection, less intrusions, improved network scanning management and network health.  HBSS upgrades will flag more anomalies to learn future intrusions and attack vectors.

[P3A - 2 / Computer Network Defense (CND) Increment 2- Ashore (DA070)]: CND Ashore sites include: Networks Operation Centers (NOCs), Outside the Continental United States (OCONUS) Navy Enterprise Network (ONE-Net) Information Assurance Suite (IAS), Broadcast Control Authorities (BCA), and Navy Cyber Defense Operations Command (NCDOC), and CND production labs. The ONE-Net security initiative consolidates Local Network Service Centers (LNSC) to their parent Theater Network Operations & Security Center (TNOSCs) for more efficient operation and enables greater failover capability between ONE-Net sites. The Virtual Training Environment (VTE) initiative supports equipment upgrades at the Navy schoolhouses. The Pre-Planned Product Improvement (P3I) initiative upgrades end-of-life equipment at the Navy Cyber Defense Operations Command (NCDOC) with a more robust capability. NCDOC is the designated Navy CND service provider, whose mission is to coordinate, monitor, analyze, and oversee the defense of Navy computer networks, NOCs, systems and is responsible for accomplishing CND cybersecurity missions. NOCs provide regional protection to shore and afloat assets within their area of responsibility (AOR).  NCDOC provides Navy-wide monitoring and defense for all the Navy NOCs. This effort will transition cybersecurity systems and capabilities from NCDOC as well as upgrade sensor grids, data correlation tools, and upgrade the Cyber Defense Mission Support System (CDMSS) architectural framework in order to provide the necessary storage capability and processing power for NCDOC to successfully ingest and analyze increased volumes of data. CND ashore sites will provide Operation Rolling Tide (ORT)/ cyber remediation tools that will accelerate the Navy's ability to prevent, constrain, and mitigate cyber-attacks and critical vulnerabilities in order to achieve improved network defense and security wholeness. ORT will procure modern network sensors improving the ability to detect unusual network patterns and prevent/deter malicious attacks.  Remediation tools will provide hardened boundary protection, less intrusions, improved network scanning management and network health.  This capability will allow for the ability to analyze a larger volume of sensor data for longer periods.   Remediation tools will reconfigure the CND enterprise infrastructure to a less ship-based software footprint by relocating security management platforms to shore sites.

[P3A - 3 / Navy Cryptography (Crypto) - Afloat (DA071)]: The Navy Crypto program is designated as Department of Navy's (DoN) Cryptographic Modernization Program Office (CMPO).  CMPO procures, installs, and provides life-cycle support for National Security Agency (NSA) Type-1 end cryptographic units for United States Navy (USN) (to include MSC platforms), United States Marine Corps (USMC), and United States Coast Guard (USCG).  

Crypto Afloat equipment includes: Families of Communications Security (COMSEC) and Transmission Security (TRANSEC) devices that are divided into crypto voice, crypto data, crypto products and associated ancillary devices.  These devices provide modern cryptographic solutions to replace obsolete, legacy devices within the crypto categories for all Services.

[P3A - 4 / Navy Cryptography (Crypto) - Ashore (DA071)]: Navy Crypto Ashore sites include: United States Navy (USN), United States Marine Corps (USMC), United States Coast Guard (USCG) facilities, production/integration sites, and training sites.

[P3A - 5 / Key Management (KM) - Afloat (DA005)]: KM is a collection of Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) Tier 2 security equipment and Tier 3 equipment Simple Key Loader (SKL).  KMI is the next generation Tier 2 product to replace the legacy Local Management Device/Key Processor (LMD/KP) Electronic Key Management System (EKMS). KMI includes the Management Client (MGC), Advanced Key Processor (AKP) and High Assurance Internet Protocol Equipment (HAIPE) devices. KMI provides a net-centric, web based architecture for the ordering, management and distribution of all cryptographic key material to support Navy users. SKL is the next generation Tier 3 Data Transfer Device (DTC) that stores, manages, transfers and loads cryptographic key material and COMSEC data through automatic loading of End Cryptographic Units (ECU).  

KM afloat systems include: KMI Suites, SKL, and KMI Spiral 2.

[P3A - 6 / Key Management (KM) - Ashore (DA005)]: KM Ashore sites include: United States Navy (USN) (to include MSC platforms), United States Marine Corps (USMC), United States Coast Guard (USCG) facilities, production integration sites, and training sites.

Justification.val:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $8.6 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The FY 2016 budget will procure the following:

Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) (DA018):  Real-Time Automated Personal Identification System (RAPIDS) hardware/software, Navy Certificate Validation Infrastructure (NCVI) Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNet) & Non-Classified Internet Protocol Router Network (NIPRNet) hardware/software, and Alternate Logon Tokens (ALT) product end items.

Cybersecurity Virtual Secure Enclave (VSE)(DA070): Client Nodes (CN) and deployable Fly Away Kits (FAK). 

Computer Network Defense (CND)(DA070): ~$16M increase from FY15/16 supports the procurement of Operation Rolling Tide (ORT)/cyber remediation tools that add additional layers of CND cybersecurity.  This equipment will secure Navy's afloat and ashore network information systems as well as accelerate the Navy's ability to prevent, constrain, and mitigate cyber-attacks and critical vulnerabilities in order to achieve improved network defense and security wholeness. ORT will procure modern network sensors improving the ability to detect unusual network patterns and prevent/deter malicious attacks.  Remediation tools will provide hardened boundary protection, less intrusions, improved network scanning management and network health.  This capability will allow for the ability to analyze a larger volume of sensor data for longer periods.  Host Based Security Systems (HBSS) upgrades will flag more anomalies to learn future intrusions and attack vectors.  CND is a layered protection strategy, using Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) and Government Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) hardware and software products that collectively provide an effective network security infrastructure.  

Navy Cryptography (Crypto)(DA071): ~$20M increase from FY15/16 reflects VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal Cryptographic Modernization (VACM) Milestone C (MS C) program delay to align with United States Air Force (USAF) program schedule.  FY16 accounts for the ramp up of VACM procurements to meet fielding schedules associated with VACM Top Secret (TS) mandates.  In addition Crypto will procure Communications Security (COMSEC) and Transmission Security (TRANSEC) devices, which are divided into crypto voice, crypto data and crypto product categories.  

Key Management (KM) (DA005): Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) Spiral 1 and 2, Simple Key Loaders (SKL) and associated ancillary equipment.

Name.@footnote: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) unit costs will vary by product type based on Navy Certificate Validation Infrastructure (NCVI) Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNet) & Non-Classified Internet Protocol Router Network (NIPRNet) shore site requirements.  Alternate Logon Tokens (ALT) are procure only and have no installation costs for Navy.
PKI - NCS Technologies provides NCVI SIPR/NIPR Afloat requirements.
PKI - SSC Atlantic provides ALT, SIPR tokens, and ashore NCVI SIPR/NIPR products.
Cybersecurity Virtual Secure Enclave (VSE) Fly Away Kits (FAK) installation costs are funded by the cognizant programs and services.
CND is designated Training Support Agent (TSA) and is required to transition initial training (train the trainer) to an approved solution at the schoolhouses.

Increase in FY16 Operating System Environment (OSE) software (SW) procurements supports the increase in afloat platforms that require ORT/cyber remediation tools, which will add additional layers of cybersecurity to afloat networks.

Name.val: 1.1.2) Operating System Environment (OSE) HW & SW - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: CND will complete their Information Assurance Tracking System (IATS) fielding in FY16.  Future procurements will be aligned with Consolidated Afloat Networks & Enterprise Services (CANES) fielding.
Increase in FY16 Laptop procurements supports the increase in afloat platforms that require ORT/cyber remediation tools, which will add additional layers of cybersecurity to CND afloat networks.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Installed:: Installation Name: Computer Network Defense (CND) Increment 2- Afloat

Description.val:
Computer Network Defense (CND) is a layered protection strategy, using Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) and Government Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) hardware and software products that collectively provide an effective network security infrastructure.  

CND Afloat systems include: System and host-based cybersecurity protection tools such as Host Based Security System (HBSS), Operation Rolling Tide (ORT)/cyber remediation tools including Assured Configuration Assessment Solution (ACAS), supporting hardware and software for Department of Defense (DoD) mandated tools, Information Assurance Tracking System (IATS), Operating System Environment (OSE), enhanced data correlation tools, switches, ancillary devices and other related security tools.  ORT/ cyber remediation tools will accelerate the Navy's ability to prevent, constrain, and mitigate cyber-attacks and critical vulnerabilities in order to achieve improved network defense and security wholeness.  ORT will procure modern network sensors improving the ability to detect unusual network patterns and prevent/deter malicious attacks.  Remediation tools will provide hardened boundary protection, less intrusions, improved network scanning management and network health.  HBSS upgrades will flag more anomalies to learn future intrusions and attack vectors.

Name.@footnote: FY16 production support increase aligns with the increase in procurements to support the ORT/cyber remediation initiative.

Pre-Planned Product Improvement (P3I) initiative for Navy Cyber Defense Operations Command (NCDOC) supports a major upgrade of end-of-life equipment with more robust capability that is required to support the NCDOC mission. Continuing improvements planned in the out years.  P3I upgrade supports the procurement of additional Operation Rolling Tide (ORT)/cyber remediation tools.

CND is designated Training Support Agent (TSA) and is required to transition equipment to an approved solution at the schoolhouses. FY16 and FY19 funds reflect equipment upgrades to the latest CND baselines.  No associated install costs.

Procurement costs for CND production labs increase in FY16 due to additional cybersecurity procurements associated with the ORT/cyber remediation initiative.  CND Production Labs procures production representative systems.  No associated install costs.

Networks Operation Centers (NOC) quantities represents multiple CND architectures and builds that are specifically procured for each site. Unit cost fluctuations vary by site type and variant. Installation cost will vary based on equipment being installed. Due to CND's rapid IT fielding, procurement costs will vary in order to meet mandated cyber security initiatives. FY16 unit cost increase supports the procurement of additional ORT/cyber remediation tools that will add additional layers of cybersecurity to CND ashore networks.

FY16 unit cost increase for Navy Cyber Defense Operations Command (NCDOC) sites support the procurement of additional ORT/cyber remediation tools that will add additional layers of cybersecurity to CND ashore networks.
Name.val: 1.1.5) Navy Cyber Defense Operations Command (NCDOC) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: FY16 unit cost increase for the Theater Network Operations & Security Center (TNOSC) sites support the procurement of additional ORT/cyber remediation tools that will add additional layers of cybersecurity to CND ashore networks.
Name.val: 1.1.6) Theater Network Operations & Security Center (TNOSC) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: VACM Design Services Agency (DSA) cost fluctuations are due to the unit configuration on the various defense agencies.

Name.val: 1.1.7) COMSEC Serial Crypto Replacement (Phase I) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: COMSEC Serial Crypto Replacement (Phase II) procure KIV-7M and ancillary equipment for installation of Secret (S) circuit requirements.

Name.@footnote: VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal Crypto Modernization (VACM) unit cost fluctuations are due to the difference in the unit configurations for Navy, United States Coast Guard (USCG) and Marines.    VACM (NonOrganic) devices are installed across five quarters due to procurement and installation lead times required to meet contractual agreements and support fleet availability.
Name.val: 1.1.10) VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal CM (VACM) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Raytheon is the KW-46 manufacturer through the National Security Agency (NSA).
Raytheon is the COMSEC Phase II manufacturer through NSA.
Raytheon is the VACM manufacturer through United States Air Force (USAF).

Name.val: CSRR - CUE - SPAWAR Systems Center Pacific

ImplementationMethodName.val: Installed:: Installation Name: Communications Security (COMSEC / CRYPTO) - Afloat

Description.val:
Navy Cryptography (Crypto) procures cryptographic equipment which includes families of Communications Security (COMSEC) and Transmission Security (TRANSEC) devices that are divided into crypto voice, crypto data, and crypto products and associated ancillary devices.  These devices provide modern cryptographic solutions to replace obsolete, legacy devices within the crypto categories. 

Crypto Data products include KIV-7M (COMSEC Serial Crypto Replacement), KW-46, Enhanced Firefly (EFF) Modernization, Cryptographic Universal Enclosures (CUE), In-Line Network Encryptors (INE), and AN-PYQ-20(v)(c). 

Crypto Voice products include VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal Cryptographic Modernization (VACM).

Name.@footnote: Original VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal Crypto Modernization (VACM) unit costs based on Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract estimates. Updated unit costs based on Milestone C (MS C) contract award, achieved May 2014. VACM procurement only (Organic) quantities represent devices only. VACM quantity fluctuations are due to revised Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) and United States Marine Corps (USMC) requirements.
Name.val: 1.1.2) VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal CM (VACM) - Organic
1.1.5) COMSEC Serial Crypto Replacement (Phase II) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: VACM (NonOrganic) quantities represent install suites (system of systems) based on configuration quantity requirements and will vary per platform or site being installed.
Raytheon is the VACM manufacturer through USAF.
Raytheon is the COMSEC Phase II manufacturer through NSA.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Organic - VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal CM (VACM)
Installed:: Installation Name: Communications Security (COMSEC / CRYPTO) - Shore

Description.val:
Navy Crypto procures cryptographic equipment which includes families of Communications Security (COMSEC) and Transmission Security (TRANSEC) devices that are divided into crypto voice, crypto data, and crypto products and associated ancillary devices.  These devices provide modern cryptographic solutions to replace obsolete, legacy devices within the crypto categories. 

Crypto Data products include KIV-7M (COMSEC Serial Crypto Replacement) and Enhanced Firefly (EFF) Modernization. Crypto Voice products include VINSON/Advanced Narrowband Digital Voice Terminal Cryptographic Modernization (VACM).

Name.@footnote: Simple Key Loader (SKL) quantities adjusted to maintain inventory objective and fielding schedules.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Not Installed - Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) Suite (MGC/AKP/HAIPE)
Installed:: Installation Name: Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) - Afloat

Description.val:
Key Management (KM) is a collection of Key Management Infrastructure (KMI)Tier 2 security equipment and Tier 3 equipment Simple Key Loader (SKL).

KMI is the next generation Tier 2 product to replace the legacy Local Management Device/Key Processor (LMD/KP) Electronic Key Management System (EKMS). KMI includes the Management Client (MGC), Advanced Key Processor (AKP) and High Assurance Internet Protocol Equipment (HAIPE) devices. KMI provides a net-centric, web based architecture for the ordering, management and distribution of all cryptographic key material to support Navy users.

SKL is the next generation Tier 3 Data Transfer Device (DTC) that stores, manages, transfers and loads cryptographic key material and COMSEC data through automatic loading of End Cryptographic Units (ECU).

Name.@footnote: Simple Key Loader (SKL) quantities adjusted to maintain inventory objective.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Not Installed - Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) Suite (MGC/AKP/HAIPE)
Installed:: Installation Name: Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) - Shore

Description.val:
Key Management is a collection of Tier 2 security equipment, Key Management Infrastructure (KMI) and Tier 3 equipment Simple Key Loader (SKL).

KMI is the next generation Tier 2 product to replace the legacy Local Management Device/Key Processor (LMD/KP) Electronic Key Management System (EKMS). KMI includes the Management Client (MGC), Advanced Key Processor (AKP) and High Assurance Internet Protocol Equipment (HAIPE) devices. KMI provides a net-centric, web based architecture for the ordering, management and distribution of all cryptographic key material to support Navy users.

SKL stores, manages, transfers and loads cryptographic key material and COMSEC data through automatic loading of End Cryptographic Units (ECU).  SKL is the next generation Data Transfer Device (DTD), which incorporates a Personal Computer Memory Card International Association card (crypto engine), Commercial-off-the-Shelf (COTS) computer and Government-off-the-Shelf (GOTS) software.
